page.title: 04COLN ROGERS
page.content: This village in the Coln Valley consists of stone-built houses most of which are old. There are two farms, and some of the houses are used for agricultural workers, the rest mainly for retired people or as second homes. The church of St. Andrew is ancient, of Saxon origin, with later Norman work aqnd is comparatively unspoilt. Services take place every other Sunday. Behind the church lies the "Old Priest's House", an ancient ecclesiastical building now somewhat derelict. The former vicarage is now in private ownership. The village has no post office, shop or any other amenity, except for a Village Hall which is used for functions such as Women's Institute meetings, sales, fairs, receptions etc. However, a mobile library calls.
